fields.description:
The default values for eucalyptus properties does not appear to be returned in the 
DescribeProperties response. We have found this would be very useful (if not a requirement)  for managing/provisioning deployments in order to efficiently maintain a view of the system's configuration, any changes, etc.. 
I currently see the  getDefaultValue() is used when reseting/modifying a property but not when fetching a property. 

Currently only name, value, and description params are returned. 
Thanks!
-Matt

comments.body: Will fixing this require an answer to EUCA-1417?
I assume you mean that in some cases the default (initial) value of a property is not the value that it is reset to. If so then this is a duplicate of EUCA-7661.

I would like to discuss how an admin could retrieve the default values for a property(s) before requesting modification of the property.  Would also like to add that 'Read/write' attributes in the describe request would be useful. 

This has come up recently as a pain point when trying to avoid coupling and tracking of the entire list of properties in potential deployment mechanisms outside of the cloud itself.
Being able to query default property values along with the read/write attributes also adds lots of UX value when simply looking at a system to see things like:

-Show an admin (or a service rep.) what items have/have not been changed on the system
-Show the admin what a reset request on a given property will result in before the request is made
-Allow for automatic testing of the properties. (this test did exist but we no longer run it due to inconsistencies, items tracked in tickets like EUCA-7661)  

Thanks!
-Matt
Added  -d, --show-default flag to euca-describe-properties that allow to show default values.

Thanks [~vasya]!!
I opened and linked EUCA-10813 to track the read/write attribute work separately as this might be a bit more involved? 
The combination of the 2 attributes returned in the request gives us a lot more utility in terms of cloud (configuration) mgmt.

Closing this ticket. Will open a separate ticket(s) to address properties which are not read-only and do not have a default value. 
Thanks, 
-M
